definition: backbone/mainstay/pillar/definite view/one's own judgment
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
bone

sentences.english: This list will be the backbone of your day.
sentences.chinese: 這份清單將會成爲你這一天的主心骨。

sentences.english: My father is the backbone of my family.
sentences.chinese: 我父親是家庭的主心骨。

sentences.english: Mom is good at keeping everyone together. She is the backbone of the family.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽經常把大家召集到一塊，她是這個家的主心骨。

sentences.english: Is there no backbone anywhere in this mess?
sentences.chinese: 在這一團亂麻中，就沒有一個主心骨嗎？

sentences.english: She is the mainstay of our workshop.
sentences.chinese: 她是我們車間的主心骨。

sentences.english: The guiding role of Marxism is the backbone of this multi-cultural.
sentences.chinese: 馬克思主義的指導地位是這種多元文化的主心骨。

sentences.english: Farming is still the mainstay of this country.
sentences.chinese: 她是我們車間的主心骨。

sentences.english: Pat was a tower of strength to our whole family.
sentences.chinese: 帕特是我們全家人的主心骨。

sentences.english: you're the face, you're the person who's supposed to  keep the troop, you know, the, the rank and file motivated.
sentences.chinese: 你是球隊的標誌，是保持球隊戰鬥力和激情的主心骨。

definition: moral pillars/spiritual props
pillar/backbone
lit. a thunder of dragons without a head/fig. a group lacking a leader
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
spiritual leader (of a nation or church)/religious leader
another name for 金箍棒[jin1 gu1 bang4]/(fig.) stabilizing force
master of the house/family head
mainstay/pillar/prop/backbone
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
patron/supporter/close to a mountain
(one's) last straw to clutch at/one's last hope
to be in charge in one's own house (idiom)/to be the master of one's own affairs
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
core/nucleus/backbone
support/backing
